metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Daman superstation upper eddy covariance system (EC) in the middle reaches of the Heihe hydrometeorological observation network from 15 September, 2012, to 31 December, 2013. The site (100.372° E, 38.856° N) was located in the maize surface, near Zhangye city in Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556 m. The EC was installed at a height of 34 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.17 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Edire post-processing software (University of Edinburgh, http://www.geos.ed.ac.uk/abs/research/micromet/EdiRe/), including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), as proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), which represent high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened using a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.12 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. Data during 26 May to 30 May and 13 July to 24 September, 2013 were missing due to the sensor calibration and maintained of CO2/H2O gas analyzer.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. 
For information of hydrometeorological network or station, please refer to Liu et al.(2018), and for observation data processing, please refer to Liu et al.(2011).

该数据集包含了2012年9月15日至2013年12月31日的黑河水文气象观测网中游大满超级站上层的涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.37223E, 38.85551N，海拔1556.06m。涡动相关仪的架高34m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Edire软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.12m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识，其中2013年5月26日-5月30日仪器标定，7月13日-9月24日CO2/H2O分析仪进行维修，该期间数据缺失。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
水文气象网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al.(2011)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡度协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和显热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强对流环境也是另一个因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层成分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，得到了E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的观察比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量，更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还由于EC系统的不确定性增加，当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，这种不确定性为18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被计算为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的空气温度、风速和湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及使用采样频率为10 Hz的涡度相关系统在4.5米高处测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔的25米高平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是利用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）以及蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）相对于ET的比率，这些研究是在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中进行的，属于黑河水文联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持了中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，其中包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with an eddy covariance system enhance the accuracy of evapotranspiration measurements in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差系统的结合如何提高异质景观中蒸散发测量的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques with an eddy covariance system provides a method to validate the ratios of evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) to evapotranspiration (ET). This approach allows for a more accurate estimation and validation of E, T, and ET by using ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures, which can be particularly effective in heterogeneous landscapes where variations in vegetation and soil components can affect energy exchange processes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差系统的结合提供了一种验证蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）与蒸散发（ET）比率的方法。这种方法通过使用地面测量的土壤和树冠组件温度，能够更准确地估计和验证E、T和ET，特别是在异质景观中，植被和土壤组件的变化可能影响能量交换过程时，这种方法尤为有效。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with using thermal infrared cameras for measuring soil and canopy temperatures, and how might these affect the accuracy of energy balance models?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用热红外相机测量土壤和树冠温度时面临哪些挑战，这些挑战可能如何影响能量平衡模型的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of thermal infrared cameras to measure soil and canopy temperatures can present challenges such as classification errors in image pixels, particularly in areas with varying vegetation abundance. This can lead to an overestimation of canopy temperatures and increased uncertainty in model outputs. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance can introduce further errors. These factors can affect the accuracy of energy balance models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model, which relies on precise temperature measurements to estimate fluxes.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用热红外相机测量土壤和冠层温度可能会面临挑战，例如图像像素的分类错误，特别是在植被丰度变化的区域。这可能导致冠层温度的过高估计，并增加模型输出的不确定性。此外，忽视大气上行辐射和透射率可能会引入进一步的误差。这些因素可能会影响能量平衡模型的准确性，例如两源能量平衡（TSEB）模型，该模型依赖于精确的温度测量来估算通量。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How does the use of a multiscale dataset obtained from remote sensing and ground-based observations contribute to understanding eco-hydrological processes in oasis-desert systems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用从遥感和地面观测获得的多尺度数据集如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠系统中的生态水文过程？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset that includes data from eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing tools such as LiDAR and thermal imagers, provides comprehensive insights into eco-hydrological processes. This approach captures data at various scales, allowing researchers to better understand interactions between oasis and desert systems, assess energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges, and address challenges in upscaling observations to broader spatial and temporal contexts.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 一个多尺度数据集，包括涡动协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及遥感工具如激光雷达和热成像仪，提供了对生态水文过程的全面洞察。这种方法在不同尺度上捕获数据，使研究人员能够更好地理解绿洲与沙漠系统之间的相互作用，评估能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，并解决将观测结果上升到更广泛空间和时间背景中的挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the key factors contributing to the challenges in accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强对流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量面临的挑战的关键因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging primarily due to the incomplete energy balance closure in the EC flux measurements concerning the available energy. The uncertainty in surface-air temperature differences, which dominates due to errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature, is a significant factor. Additionally, the strong advective environment in such regions further complicates the estimation process.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，主要是由于EC通量测量在可用能量方面存在能量平衡闭合不完全的问题。表面空气温度差的不确定性是一个重要因素，因为从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差占主导地位。此外，这些区域强烈的平流环境进一步复杂化了估计过程。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a need for hierarchical nested scales in instrumentation to observe eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在仪器观测异质表面的生态水文过程时需要分层嵌套的尺度？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need for hierarchical nested scales in instrumentation to observe eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces arises from the challenge of upscaling these processes. Poor availability of multiscale observations hinders progress in understanding such processes. Hierarchically nested scales help in capturing multiscale eco-hydrological processes by arranging instruments to observe interactions across different scales, such as oasis-desert interactions, thereby providing comprehensive data for analysis.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在仪器观测异质表面的生态水文过程时，层次嵌套尺度的需求源于对这些过程进行上尺度处理的挑战。多尺度观测的稀缺性阻碍了对这些过程的理解。层次嵌套尺度通过安排仪器以观察不同尺度之间的相互作用（例如绿洲-沙漠相互作用），帮助捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，从而提供全面的数据进行分析。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the high uncertainty in the estimation of H using the TSEB model in irrigated farmland?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在灌溉农田中，使用TSEB模型估计H时，导致高不确定性的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The high uncertainty in the estimation of H using the TSEB model in irrigated farmland is primarily caused by errors in derived component temperatures due to image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. Additionally, the uncertainty is exacerbated by the EC system's inherent uncertainty, which affects the H estimation, especially when the mean H is small. Other factors, such as ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance, also contribute to the uncertainties in estimating temperatures and, consequently, the H estimation.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在灌溉农田中，使用TSEB模型估算H时的不确定性主要是由于派生组件温度的误差，这些误差源于图像分类错误，并且随着植被丰度的变化而变化。此外，EC系统固有的不确定性也加剧了这种不确定性，特别是在平均H较小时，对H的估算影响更大。其他因素，如忽略大气上行辐射和透射率，也会导致温度估算的不确定性，从而影响H的估算。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might the application of the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model using high-resolution thermal camera data impact the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用高分辨率热成像相机数据应用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型如何影响异质景观中蒸散发估算的准确性？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The application of the TSEB model using high-resolution thermal camera data can significantly improve the accuracy of evapotranspiration estimates in heterogeneous landscapes. By providing precise measurements of soil and canopy component temperatures, this method enhances the estimation of evaporation and transpiration rates, ultimately leading to more reliable predictions of surface energy fluxes and better water resource management.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪数据应用TSEB模型可以显著提高异质景观中蒸散发估算的准确性。通过提供土壤和冠层组分温度的精确测量，这种方法增强了蒸发和蒸腾速率的估算，最终导致对表面能量通量的更可靠预测以及更好的水资源管理。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the implications of using eddy covariance systems and other ground-based measurements for validating remote sensing data in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和其他地面测量方法来验证干旱和半干旱地区的遥感数据的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using eddy covariance systems and other ground-based measurements to validate remote sensing data in arid and semiarid regions can enhance the reliability and accuracy of satellite-derived estimates. This approach helps in addressing issues related to energy balance closure and temperature estimation errors, thereby strengthening the overall analysis of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in these challenging environments.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和其他地面测量来验证干旱和半干旱地区的遥感数据，可以提高卫星衍生估计的可靠性和准确性。这种方法有助于解决能量平衡闭合和温度估计误差相关的问题，从而增强对这些挑战性环境中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的整体分析。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the main objectives of collecting multiscale and multidisciplinary data in oasis-desert systems using hierarchically nested scales?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在使用分层嵌套尺度收集绿洲-沙漠系统的多尺度和多学科数据时，主要目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The main objectives are to address the challenge of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces by capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes and understanding oasis-desert interactions, which is significant for protecting ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目标是通过捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，解决在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的挑战，并理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用，这对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to use a combination of stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques alongside eddy covariance measurements for validating evapotranspiration estimates?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么将稳定氧和氢同位素技术与涡度协方差测量相结合，对于验证蒸散发估算值是重要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: It is important because these methods provide a better validation of evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration estimates by accurately measuring the ratios of evaporation to transpiration, helping to improve the precision of models like the TSEB model.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 这很重要，因为这些方法通过准确测量蒸发与蒸腾的比率，提供了对蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发估算的更好验证，从而有助于提高像TSEB模型这样的模型的精确度。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the significance of establishing a dataset that includes long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 建立包含绿洲-沙漠生态系统中长期能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量的数据集有什么重要意义？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The significance lies in providing a quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing oasis-desert interactions and for supporting ecological security and sustainable development goals, such as carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 其重要性在于提供对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用以及支持生态安全和可持续发展目标（如碳达峰和碳中和）至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are involved in processing eddy covariance data from 10Hz raw observations to 30-minute averaged datasets in hydrometeorological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在水文气象研究中，将涡度相关数据从10Hz的原始观测处理为30分钟的平均数据集涉及哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedures involved in processing eddy covariance data include outlier removal, delay time correction, coordinate rotation (secondary coordinate rotation), frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Additionally, flux values undergo quality evaluation, focusing on atmospheric stability and turbulent similarity characteristics. The processed data is screened by removing erroneous data, data before and after precipitation, data with high missing rates, and weak turbulence data at night. The processed data result in 30-minute averages, with missing or suspicious data marked accordingly.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 处理涡度协方差数据的程序包括异常值去除、延迟时间修正、坐标旋转（次级坐标旋转）、频率响应修正、超声波虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正。此外，通量值还需进行质量评估，重点关注大气稳定性和湍流相似性特征。处理后的数据经过筛选，去除错误数据、降水前后的数据、高缺失率的数据以及夜间弱湍流数据。处理后的数据以30分钟为平均值，缺失或可疑数据相应标记。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are used to partition evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration in fields with heterogeneous land surfaces?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在具有异质土地表面的田地中，使用哪些方法将蒸散划分为蒸发和蒸腾？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Evapotranspiration can be partitioned into evaporation and transpiration by using ground-based measurements in conjunction with models like the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. Field observations, such as those obtained from thermal infrared cameras, are used to measure soil and canopy component temperatures. These observations, combined with stable isotope techniques and eddy covariance system measurements, help validate the partitioning of evapotranspiration into its components. The Craig–Gordon model can also be applied for this partitioning using ground-based measurement data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 蒸散发可以通过地面测量与模型（如双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型）结合进行分解为蒸发和蒸腾。现场观测，例如通过热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件温度，用于测量。这些观测结果结合稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差系统测量，有助于验证蒸散发的分解成分。Craig-Gordon模型也可以应用于使用地面测量数据进行这种分解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements enable the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在绿洲-沙漠系统中收集多尺度生态水文数据成为可能？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert systems is enabled by advancements in instrumentation, including eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，多尺度生态水文数据的收集得益于仪器技术的进步，包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、生态水文传感器网络以及超高分辨率的空中遥感技术，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do specific data processing techniques enhance the accuracy and reliability of flux measurements in arid agricultural areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 特定的数据处理技术如何提高干旱农业地区通量测量的准确性和可靠性？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing techniques such as the use of Edire software for filtering, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, and quality evaluations based on atmospheric stability and turbulence similarity enhance the accuracy and reliability of flux measurements in arid agricultural areas by addressing instrument errors, data gaps, and environmental factors.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理技术，如使用Edire软件进行过滤、坐标旋转、频率响应校正，以及基于大气稳定性和湍流相似性的质量评估，通过解决仪器误差、数据缺口和环境因素，提高了干旱农业地区通量测量的准确性和可靠性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions and methods enable effective partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration over heterogeneous land surfaces?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些条件和方法能够有效地将蒸散发划分为蒸发和植物蒸腾作用，适用于异质土地表面？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Effective partitioning of evapotranspiration into evaporation and transpiration over heterogeneous land surfaces is enabled by conditions such as the availability of high-resolution thermal imaging and the use of models like the Two-Source Energy Balance (TSEB) model, which employs ground-measured soil and canopy temperatures, stable isotope techniques, and eddy covariance measurements to refine estimations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 有效地将蒸散发划分为蒸发和蒸腾，依赖于高分辨率热成像的可用性以及像双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型这样的模型，该模型利用地面测量的土壤和冠层温度、稳定同位素技术和涡度协方差测量来精确估算。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the eddy covariance system not achieve full energy balance closure in strongly advective agricultural areas?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在强烈的平流农业区域，涡动协方差系统可能无法实现完全的能量平衡闭合？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Accurately estimating surface fluxes in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas is challenging due to the incomplete energy balance closure of EC flux measurements with respect to available energy. The uncertainty in the surface–air temperature difference and the errors in determining surface soil and vegetation component temperatures contribute to this challenge.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一个挑战，因为涡度协方差（EC）通量测量与可用能量之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的问题。表面与空气温度差的测量不确定性以及表层土壤和植被组分温度确定中的误差加剧了这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why are multiscale observations difficult to obtain in eco-hydrological studies of oasis-desert environments?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠环境的生态水文研究中，获取多尺度观测数据是困难的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in upscaling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. Such complexity requires hierarchically nested instrumentation to capture the diverse eco-hydrological processes and interactions across different scales, which are often not readily available.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上提升生态水文过程的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。这种复杂性需要分层嵌套的仪器来捕捉不同尺度上多样的生态水文过程和相互作用，而这些仪器往往并不容易获得。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do current composite temperature separation approaches show limited effectiveness in arid regions when estimating evapotranspiration components?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区估算蒸散发组成部分时效果有限的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The effectiveness of current composite temperature separation approaches is limited in arid regions because errors in the derived component temperatures are mainly caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. This leads to increased uncertainty in estimating sensible heat flux, as soil pixels may be incorrectly classified as vegetation pixels, resulting in an overestimation of canopy temperature.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性受到限制，因为衍生的组成温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这导致在估算显热通量时的不确定性增加，因为土壤像素可能被错误分类为植被像素，从而导致对冠层温度的过高估计。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: To what extent do you believe the integration of stable isotope techniques with eddy covariance systems enhances the validation of evapotranspiration estimates?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差系统的结合在多大程度上增强了蒸散发估算的验证？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The integration of stable isotope techniques with eddy covariance systems significantly enhances the validation of evapotranspiration estimates by providing more accurate partitioning of evaporation and transpiration components. This combination allows for better validation of estimated ratios of evaporation and transpiration, contributing to a more precise understanding of evapotranspiration dynamics in heterogeneous landscapes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 稳定同位素技术与涡度协方差系统的结合显著增强了蒸散发估算的验证，通过提供更准确的蒸发和蒸腾成分的划分。这种组合使得对蒸发和蒸腾比率的估算进行更好的验证，从而有助于更精确地理解异质景观中的蒸散发动态。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting multiscale observations in oasis-desert regions.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度观测数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting multiscale observations in oasis-desert regions include the poor availability of such data due to the complex and heterogeneous nature of these landscapes. Additionally, image classification errors due to varying vegetation abundance can lead to inaccuracies in temperature estimations, which affect the data collection process.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度观测数据的挑战包括由于这些景观的复杂性和异质性，相关数据的可用性较差。此外，由于植被丰度的变化导致的图像分类错误可能会导致温度估算的不准确，从而影响数据收集过程。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets integrate various remote sensing and ground-based measurements for studying oasis-desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解数据集如何整合各种遥感和地面测量，以研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets integrate remote sensing and ground-based measurements by using a combination of flux observation matrices, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing. Instruments such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers are used alongside eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations to capture comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in these ecosystems.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集通过结合通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和超高分辨率航空遥感，整合了遥感和地面测量。使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪等仪器，以及涡度协方差塔和自动气象站，捕获这些生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in the estimation of evapotranspiration using the two-source energy balance model in heterogeneous surfaces.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析在异质表面使用双源能量平衡模型估算蒸散发所面临的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in estimating evapotranspiration using the two-source energy balance model on heterogeneous surfaces include difficulties in accurately calculating resistances, obtaining required parameters and observations, and image classification errors that affect component temperature estimation. The complexity of the TSEB model and the strong advective environments also contribute to uncertainties in estimations.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 使用双源能量平衡模型在异质表面上估算蒸散发面临的挑战包括准确计算阻力的困难、获取所需参数和观测数据的难度，以及影响组分温度估计的图像分类错误。TSEB模型的复杂性和强烈的平流环境也增加了估算的不确定性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe potential strategies for improving the accuracy of eco-hydrological data collection in arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述提高干旱地区生态水文数据收集准确性的潜在策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Improving the accuracy of eco-hydrological data collection in arid regions can involve addressing the poor availability of multiscale observations through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, implementing intensive observation periods, and using advanced remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR and multi-angle thermal imagers. Ensuring rigorous sensor calibration, data processing, and quality control procedures are also crucial strategies.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 提高干旱地区生态水文数据收集的准确性可以通过以下方式实现：在分层嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以解决多尺度观测的稀缺性；实施密集观测期；以及使用先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）和多角度热成像仪。确保严格的传感器校准、数据处理和质量控制程序也是至关重要的策略。
